Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @phm87 for the record, i am not against LN tech, in fact i designed it into the CHIPS gameplay. what i object to is pretending that LN is some sort of decentralized layer. for interfacing to a centralized service, using a non-decentralized onramp, seems like you are not increasing any exposure. just dont complain if it turns out there are some funds are not safu type of bugs. for buying a latte, sure. for making a 10 BTC deposit... probably not a good idea

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also LN seems to have built in dependency to segwit, when it doesnt actually need to do that. this reminds of microsoft methods

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
Sorry for my wrong interpretation. As far as i know, there are limits (for safety) into LN around 0.04 BTC per channel and it is written everywhere that it is in development and subject to risks so unsure why someone will put 10 BTC on LN (maybe for profit/greed). I'd prefer that you discuss segwit with a LN developer rather than me.
About the centralization/decentralization, the network is very young and some big players tried to centralize it with bad results (LN.big still loose money). Mobile light wallets are using the default node (so LN mobile wallets suffer from the same problem that Ethereum have with infura infra)

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Anyway, you know how I talk about risk and about crypto, you know that I won't push users to put funds at risk

Author: phm87#7395
Content: @jl777c  I think that most of LN guys will agree with you about ``for buying a latte, sure. for making a 10 BTC deposit... probably not a good idea`` so we both agree that LN is designed for small amounts. If anybody change the code to be able to play with several BTC, he should know what he is doing (same apply if I overclock a CPU or if I tune up a car: most insurances don't work from this point). Same apply if I do weird transactions with LABS or Hush with one instable git branch

Author: phm87#7395
Content: About CHIPS, I think that it can be possible to perform a submarine swap between CHIPS and KMD/Hush/LABS. It can be cool

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as a centralized payment hub, LN has its place, but that is not replacing bitpay

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: does LN need to be on both sides of the submarine?

Author: phm87#7395
Content: no no no

Author: phm87#7395
Content: <https://medium.com/suredbits/how-do-submarine-swaps-work-907ed0d91498>

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
LN on one side : the secret preimage is revealed after paying the invoice
onchain on the other side: an HTLC is put in place with a timelack and using the hash of the preimage to be able to claim funds

Author: phm87#7395
Content: <https://github.com/submarineswaps/swaps-service/blob/master/docs/chain_swap_script.md>

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it seems an mm2 module could be made to build in submarine swaps

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I'm still noob in bitcoin scripts but I think that mm2 can also work for this

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I agree with you

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as it has the require hashlocks and i assume timelocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i appreciate you swimming against the current on this one, it is a good effort

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I don't fight against you

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Thank you for the talk

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yet somehow you feel that KMD is against LN

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as long as tech isnt misrepresented, almost all tech has some usecases where it makes sense to be used. that is all i ask, like when the pro-segwit was saying it was a scaling solution, when it actually makes the blocks a little bigger (with same set of transactions)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is basically just lying and not a very good way

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and you cant claim that the network cant handle 4MB blocks so the blocksize has to remain at 1MB, when segwit allows the block to be 4MB.

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I had long discussions with bitcoiners and consensus experts (guys similar to zawy but about consensus) on french chats about KMD whitepapers, I'm not here to copy paste disagreements

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I agree that segwit allows blocks to go up to sth like 4 MB

Author: phm87#7395
Content: the documentation says the same

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with dPoW, we have actual attacks that are stopped, proven with live tests.

Author: phm87#7395
Content: as these live tests are not publicly documented, it is difficult to proove anything

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is basically just a decentralized checkpoint, submitted by notaries

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the attacks that were attempted and stopped was public

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: chains that were being constantly attacked and now with dPoW are not attacked, this is public

Author: phm87#7395
Content: whatever the tech detailed discussion is about LN or dpow, it is easier to put in the same chat all the persons. I took hours of my time to copy paste explanations from one group to another group. It doesn't help

Author: phm87#7395
Content: The fast that attackers stopped to attack is indeed public but there is still no documented test of dpow

Author: phm87#7395
Content: anyway, we'll discuss such a test with notaries in privNN

Author: phm87#7395
Content: more transparency is always good

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not sure what exactly you mean about a documented test that is different than what was done, but nothing stops it from being done

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and also the source code has always been open in the daemon

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I never saw any link to any documented test about dpow but I'd be happy to read, learn, execute test again

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if a notarization is invalid, ignore it. if it is valid, then prevent reorging

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: combined with dpowconfs allows to know when it is secure to trust a txid

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Compared to analysis of pos, pow and other stuff, there is a lack of written docs (math docs, theretical docs) on dpow and I never saw a documented test but I'll search

Author: phm87#7395
Content: pow and pos have some flaws that are documented (flaws of LN are also documented)

Author: phm87#7395
Content: it can be good for transparency to document problems of dpow

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what sort of math is there about a decentralized checkpoint?

Author: phm87#7395
Content: (Alright told me things in private, mostly theoric)

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I saw some calculations based on the number of connections between the 64 NN (on privNN), the risk of collusion (mostly theoric because we have good notaries) and so on

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: certainly, nothing is perfect, but having dPoW is much more secure than not having it, for some chains, without dPoW they are basically not usable. i dont talk about chains with a lot of hashpower already

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the cost of attack is much much higher on a dPoW chain, than without. this is pretty clear

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I agree, dpow is good but we need more technical explanations about it.

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Most of ppl outside KMD are seeing NN as masternodes so they think that dpow is subject to all the attacks that exist on masternodes (whatever NN and MN are technically very different)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is no point to debate people who dont bother to understand the most basic facts

Author: phm87#7395
Content: @jl777c  you said that LN is unsecure but the few users that lost funds were above limits and they did stupid moves (it is masochism to broadcast an old state of a channel). About the fast that it is a little bit centralized around few nodes (LN.big control 40% of LN nodes), most noobs are using eclair node (same problem apply for ethereum and infura infra). But as bitfinex opened a LN node, it might get centralized around bitfinex

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I hope that in a few weeks, Binance will use his LN node on mainet then it will be also centralized around Binance

Author: phm87#7395
Content: But today's LN tpology gives you right : it is centralized around few nodes. But it tends to be more decentralized with the time

Author: phm87#7395
Content: eclair LN node was pretty the only one used few years ago, now CEX wants to have their LN node, it is fun

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the prediction was that LN will lead to centralized hubs and that is exactly what is happening

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: where the CEX are becoming the centralized hubs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with KYC, just as predicted

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I can show you that all measures show that it is getting more decentralized

Author: phm87#7395
Content: there are 3 LN exchanges, no KYC

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I won't add a KYC into atomicdex if I enable submarine swaps (with LN so)

Author: phm87#7395
Content: KYC is mostly for fiat or big amounts (for AML regulation), not related to LN

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but practically speaking the vast majority of LN volumes will go via these CEX nodes which will then be forced to KYC

Author: phm87#7395
Content: maybe in the future

Author: phm87#7395
Content: but right now, the biggest volumes is not coming from the usual CEX. Biggest volume were in some services providers (phone stuf, VPS). Anyway, it can evolve pretty quickly

Author: phm87#7395
Content: LN.big arrived and added 40% to LN funds, controlling 40% of nodes and creating channels with everyone, they arrived in one week. It was scary

Author: joe2x4#5987
Content:
This is what I was expecting, stablecoins on physical medium will simply become cash. How exciting to be able to print your own cash.

```https://www.armstrongeconomics.com/armstrongeconomics101/economics/will-store-gift-cards-become-cash/
There seems to be a loophole right now with the gift cards. When I tried to buy an American Express debit card and load it with a couple hundred for a gift to send overseas, I was told I could not. It can only be in my name. As it stands now, if governments eliminated paper money but still allowed gift cards in bearer form, then they would simply become cash. It would seem that store cash gift cards would become the circulating cash in the black market economy. When that becomes more commonplace, they would probably shut that down or make them non-transferable in some name that is specific.```
